subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] new course for MemRise; new decks for ANKI
msgSnippet: Ben, I m glad you found this site and are enjoying it.  I started the site a number of years ago.  At that time, I was cautioned against it, because one person
messageBody:
Ben,

I'm glad you found this site and are enjoying it.  I started the site a number of years ago.  At that time, I was cautioned against it, because one person in particular was concerned that it would divide the advocates of a new English alphabet, as promoted by G. B. Shaw and and brought to reality by Kingsley Read, and would be a negative influence overall.

I did not see competition with Shawscript as a problem.  I have never regretted starting the site.  We have a large group of members who, I am confident, use the alphabet in their lives to advantage.

I will say that I have personally found the alphabet very useful over the last 45 years or so.

Enjoy!


Paige Gabhart


On 9/26/2015 12:45 PM, trybloganatgmail@... [Read_Alphabet] wrote:
 

Hello to all,


Now I've gotten the QuickScript bug!


I figure my best contribution is to upload a MemRise course on the subject <http://www.memrise.com/course/784058/quickscript-for-beginners/>, and--while I'm at it--make some ANKI decks.


Fun, fun, fun!  I do not know what to do about reconciling Read's English with my own South-Eastern US accent.  For now, I'm tending toward Read's methods, though I often don't agree with his vowels.  And I cannot bring myself to "garage" with a soft "zh".  Other than that, things will sift out.


I welcome your comments, and thank you so much for this site!


Sincerely,


Ben
